result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

01:35 PM. JL-Clerk. JOINT PH IN CASES 22CF5, 22CF6. 01:25 PM. JL-Clerk. Defendant Timothy Wayne Ramsey in court with attorney A.W. Schutte.  Defendant Timothy Wayne Ramsey in custody.  Defendant Priscilla Lorene Drennan in court with attorney Donna Burger.  Defendant Priscilla Lorene Drennan in custody. Attorney David Stilin in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. State calls Officer Vollendorf - S&T. CT finds identification of each defendant is made. Cross by Atty Burger. Cross by Atty Schutte. Atty Stilin redirect. CT finds PC as to each case, each defendant bound over for trial. Atty Schutte and Atty Burger motion for bond modifcation. State does not object to signature bond on on 22CF5, DOES object to modification of bond on 22CF6. CT grants motion to modify bonds on both cases. Bond cont. 2:00 pm adj.  Arraignment scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 11:45 am.
